Text: On the floor strongly opposing a Republican bill targeting the due process rights of federal employees. Another attack on our hard-working federal workforce.

At @GOPoversight markup of bill seeking to roll back regulations, I'm offering an amendment to ensure rules or regulations regarding sexual harassment would not be subject to repeal or modification.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CpW9-IHpfrw …

After hearing from a constituent who experienced a disturbing eviction by US Marshals, I posed detailed questions to US Marshals on DC eviction policies and training. Federal officials must be held accountable to DC residents they serve.http://bit.ly/2Atq7cM

.@SenTedCruz is violating every local control bone in his body w/ his radical bill to force DC to direct its local funds away from DCPS and public charter schools to private school vouchers. Working w/ allies to defeat, as we did last Congress. #HandsOffDChttp://bit.ly/2BwL8kL

.@HouseGOP is responding to recent gun massacres in our country by marking up a dangerous bill to nationalize concealed carry, allowing people from states with weak gun laws to conceal-carry in DC. The sane response is to pass gun violence prevention legislation to save lives.

On the House floor speaking on bipartisan bill to require Members and staff to complete anti-harassment and anti-discrimination training. Congressional staff still lack comprehensive protections afforded to executive branch and private sector workers. My bill would change that.

When I chaired the EEOC, we defined sexual harassment for the first time as workplace discrimination and required private employers to take steps to eliminate it. It’s time for Congress to catch up.

Sexual harassment training educates workers and employers about unwelcome advances. My staff and I have completed the training, and I wrote my colleague urging they do the same even before it becomes mandatory. #ThisWeekpic.twitter.com/FqK1YdtLIr

Catch the replay of this morning's @ThisWeekABC episode to watch our discussion on confronting sexual harassment. Airing at 7pm on @NewsChannel8.http://abcnews.go.com/ThisWeek/video/wave-sexual-harassment-allegations-hits-capitol-hill-51255260 …

On @ThisWeekABC tomorrow at 9am to discuss sexual harassment on Capitol Hill and the work still to be done since we first declared sexual harassment a form of discrimination when I chaired the EEOC.

Sat down with Anita Hill and several Members of Congress this week to discuss her battle against sexual harassment. Bringing the issue forward, I’ll be on @ThisWeekABC tomorrow at 9am on the work ahead to confront sexual harassment on Cap Hill and throughout American workplaces.
Tune into @ABC tomorrow at 9am!https://twitter.com/abcnewspr/status/931974489759502337 …

Because we persisted, the U.S. Senate allowed Anita Hill to tell her history-making story to the nation. Americans heard her and, in 1992, tripled the # of women to the Senate and elected a record # of women to the House (24 new members).pic.twitter.com/MG3m7znbLs

Honored @NancyPelosi has appointed me and Kenneth Morris, Jr., the great-great-great grandson of Frederick Douglass, to serve on the Frederick Douglass Bicentennial Commission, which was established by my bill. Looking forward to the bipartisan work of honoring Douglass' life!

Sat down with Anita Hill today to recall her courageous stand against sexual harassment and the march to the Senate by a few House Members and I to demand she be allowed to testify. 7/ Repeal of DC budget autonomy referendum is not only bad policy; it violates one of our nation's most revered principles—local control.
6/ DC’s budget is bigger than the budgets of 14 states.  The District raises $8 billion in local funds.
5/ Budget autonomy has benefits for DC: lower borrowing costs, more accurate revenue and expenditure forecasts, & improved agency operations
4/ Congress loses nothing under budget autonomy. Congress retains authority to legislate on any DC matter, including its local budget.
3/ Astonishing Repubs are so opposed to a local jurisdiction spending its local funds w/out the approval of a federal body, the US Congress.
2/ DC’s Local Budget Autonomy Act allows D.C. to spend its local funds, raised solely in DC, after a 30-day congressional review period

The repeal of DC budget autonomy referendum is not only bad policy; it is a blight on this country’s most revered principle—local control.
Budget autonomy has practical benefits for DC: lower borrowing costs, improved agency operations, & removal of DC government shutdown threat
Local control over locally-raised funds is a principle much-cited by Republicans, and is central to the American form of government.
Budget autonomy = modest attempt by DC to implement its budget soon after it is passed, like all other jurisdictions. BA is not statehood.
Congress loses nothing under budget autonomy. It retains authority to legislate on any DC matter, including its local budget, at any time.
Budget autonomy is law of the land: DC Superior Court upheld it, no appeal was filed, and the court ordered DC employees to implement it.
